timeline.bodyText: I'm a bit puzzled by the original code here. Since the queued timestamp and currentTime are both in microseconds, dividing by 1,000,000 implies that timediff is in discrete seconds and not in milliseconds. Expected wait period will therefore be off by a few orders of magnitude... I don't think this has mattered in practice, since it just means we'll wake up the thread more frequently than strictly required.
timeline.author: vekterli
